The final document was reviewed by a group of external experts."}],"$":{"view":"all","role":"materials-methods","id":"abss0002"},"#name":"abstract-sec"},{"$$":[{"$":{"id":"cesectitle0004"},"#name":"section-title","_":"Results"},{"$":{"view":"all","id":"spara012"},"#name":"simple-para","_":"A consensus position was reached regarding the multi-professional nature of support for trans youth, the prescription of molecules aimed at inhibiting endogenous hormone secretion, and the use of gender-affirming hormone therapies, as well as the importance of offering gamete preservation. Non-hormonal aspects of support and various considerations, including ethical ones, were also discussed."}],"$":{"view":"all","role":"results","id":"abss0003"},"#name":"abstract-sec"},{"$$":[{"$":{"id":"cesectitle0005"},"#name":"section-title","_":"Conclusion"},{"$":{"view":"all","id":"spara013"},"#name":"simple-para","_":"This work constitutes an initial set of recommendations for professionals involved in the hormonal transition of trans youth. Additional recommendations under the auspices of the French High Authority for Health would be worthy of being drafted, involving all relevant stakeholders to establish comprehensive official national guidelines that would secure the support and rights of these young individuals, especially those under 16 years old, as well as the professionals involved in their care."}],"$":{"view":"all","role":"conclusion","id":"abss0004"},"#name":"abstract-sec"}],"$":{"view":"all","id":"abs0001","class":"author"},"#name":"abstract"}],"floats":[],"footnotes":[],"attachments":[]},"accessbarConfig":{"fallback":false,"id":"accessbar","version":"0.0.1","analytics":{"location":"accessbar","eventName":"ctaImpression"},"label":{},"ariaLabel":{"accessbar":"Download options and search","componentsList":"PDF Options"},"banners":[{"id":"BannerSsrn"}],"components":[{"target":"_blank","analytics":[{"ids":["accessbar:fta:single-article"],"eventName":"ctaClick"}],"label":"View **PDF**","ariaLabel":"View PDF. class="PageDivider"></div><div class="Abstracts u-font-serif" id="abstracts"><div class="abstract author" id="abs0001"><h2 class="section-title u-h4 u-margin-l-top u-margin-xs-bottom">Abstract</h2><div id="abss0001"><h3 class="u-h4 u-margin-m-top u-margin-xs-bottom" id="cesectitle0002">Introduction</h3><div class="u-margin-s-bottom" id="spara010">Requests for hormonal transition in minors are increasing. To date, there is no national recommendation to guide these practices in France. Therefore, the SFEDP (French Society of Pediatric Endocrinology and Diabetology) has commissioned a group of experts to draft the first national consensus on this topic.</div></div><div id="abss0002"><h3 class="u-h4 u-margin-m-top u-margin-xs-bottom" id="cesectitle0003">Method</h3><div class="u-margin-s-bottom" id="spara011">Each chapter was prepared by one to three authors who conducted a literature review, and it was then reviewed and revised by the group as many times as necessary to achieve a consensus position. The final document was reviewed by a group of external experts.</div></div><div id="abss0003"><h3 class="u-h4 u-margin-m-top u-margin-xs-bottom" id="cesectitle0004">Results</h3><div class="u-margin-s-bottom" id="spara012">A consensus position was reached regarding the multi-professional nature of support for trans youth, the prescription of molecules aimed at inhibiting endogenous hormone secretion, and the use of gender-affirming hormone therapies, as well as the importance of offering gamete preservation. Non-hormonal aspects of support and various considerations, including ethical ones, were also discussed.</div></div><div id="abss0004"><h3 class="u-h4 u-margin-m-top u-margin-xs-bottom" id="cesectitle0005">Conclusion</h3><div class="u-margin-s-bottom" id="spara013">This work constitutes an initial set of recommendations for professionals involved in the hormonal transition of trans youth. Additional recommendations under the auspices of the French High Authority for Health would be worthy of being drafted, involving all relevant stakeholders to establish comprehensive official national guidelines that would secure the support and rights of these young individuals, especially those under 16 years old, as well as the professionals involved in their care.</div></div></div></div><div class="Keywords u-font-serif"><div id="keys0001" class="keywords-section"><h2 class="section-title u-h4 u-margin-l-top u-margin-xs-bottom">Keywords</h2><div id="key0001" class="keyword"><span id="cetext0002">Transgender adolescent</span></div><div id="key0002" class="keyword"><span id="cetext0003">Hormonal treatment</span></div><div id="key0003" class="keyword"><span id="cetext0004">GnRH analogs</span></div><div id="key0004" class="keyword"><span id="cetext0005">Estrogens,</span></div><div id="key0005" class="keyword"><span id="cetext0006">Testosterone</span></div><div id="key0006" class="keyword"><span id="cetext0007">Consensus</span></div></div></div><div class="related-content-links u-display-none-from-md"><button class="button-link button-link-primary button-link-small" type="button"><span class="button-link-text-container"><span class="button-link-text">Recommended articles</span></span></button></div><div class="Tail"></div><div></div><div id="section-cited-by"><section aria-label="Cited by" class="ListArticles preview"><div class="PageDivider"></div><header id="citing-articles-header"><h2 class="u-h4 u-margin-l-ver u-font-serif">Cited by (0)</h2></header><div aria-describedby="citing-articles-header"></div></section></div><div class="Copyright"><span class="copyright-line">© 2024 The Author(s). readabilityObject.title: Endocrine management of transgender adolescents: Expert consensus of the french society of pediatric endocrinology and diabetology working group
readabilityObject.content:
• View PDF

Under a Creative Commons license

open access

Abstract

Introduction

Requests for hormonal transition in minors are increasing. To date, there is no national recommendation to guide these practices in France. Therefore, the SFEDP (French Society of Pediatric Endocrinology and Diabetology) has commissioned a group of experts to draft the first national consensus on this topic.

Method

Each chapter was prepared by one to three authors who conducted a literature review, and it was then reviewed and revised by the group as many times as necessary to achieve a consensus position. The final document was reviewed by a group of external experts.

Results

A consensus position was reached regarding the multi-professional nature of support for trans youth, the prescription of molecules aimed at inhibiting endogenous hormone secretion, and the use of gender-affirming hormone therapies, as well as the importance of offering gamete preservation. Non-hormonal aspects of support and various considerations, including ethical ones, were also discussed.

Conclusion

This work constitutes an initial set of recommendations for professionals involved in the hormonal transition of trans youth. Additional recommendations under the auspices of the French High Authority for Health would be worthy of being drafted, involving all relevant stakeholders to establish comprehensive official national guidelines that would secure the support and rights of these young individuals, especially those under 16 years old, as well as the professionals involved in their care.

Keywords

Transgender adolescent

Hormonal treatment

GnRH analogs

Estrogens,

Testosterone

Consensus
